title: Douglas Gonzaga Leite
text:
Douglas Gonzaga Leite (born March 27, 1980), or simply Douglas, is a Brazilian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who currently plays from <a href="Guarani%20Futebol%20Clube">Guarani</a> in the <a href="Campeonato%20Paulista%20S%C3%A9rie%20A2">Série A2</a> as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Career.
Douglas came to football at St. Joseph Sports Club. It went through several clubs in Brazil and abroad, and hit his engagement with the Avaí on May 11, 2008, where he was reserve goalkeeper Eduardo Martini's campaign team in the Campeonato Brasileiro Serie B 2008 culminating in the achievement of access the series A. Later, Douglas was hired by Mirassol to compete in the Paulista championship in 2009, but did not even play for the club is moving straight to the Guarani to fight for the championship.
In July 2013 Leite signed for <a href="Azerbaijan%20Premier%20League">Azerbaijan Premier League</a> side <a href="FK%20Khazar%20Lankaran">Khazar Lankaran</a>. On 25 November 2013 it was announced that Douglas would leave Khazar Lankaran to re-sign with <a href="Guarani%20Futebol%20Clube">Guarani</a> for the 2014 <a href="Campeonato%20Paulista%20S%C3%A9rie%20A2">Série A2</a> season.
